title: David James slams Strictly curse rumours with Nadiya Bychkova
text:
David James slams Strictly curse rumours with Nadiya Bychkova (Picture: PA)

David James has quashed all rumours of the Strictly Come Dancing curse rolling into effect between himself and his professional partner, Nadiya Bychkova.

Speculation started when the footballer appeared to have all the chemistry with the dancer during last week’s routine.

However, it turns out there’s nothing going on between the pair, so can we all just calm down now?

According to The Mirror, the 49-year-old explained: ‘My view is that, in life itself, if two people are attracted to each other then something might happen, and it doesn’t need to be Strictly that causes that.

‘I think the situation with Nadiya and myself… there’s a goal in this. Nadiya is a fantastic teacher, I want to be a fantastic student, but we’re on Strictly Come Dancing, not Love Island or some other show where people get themselves together.’

He said he’s on Strictly not Love Island (Picture: PA)

He added: ‘As I said, I think the chemistry between the two of us is perfect because we know what we’re here for and we’re enjoying the process, even though being in the dance-off isn’t fun.’

Advertisement

Advertisement

The couple will be heading into the third live show with a quickstep to The Greatest Showman’s From Now On.

And if it appears they have sexual chemistry, the former goalkeeper is more than okay with that.

He stated: ‘If that’s what it looks like then we’re happy.’

The pair will be quickstepping their way into the third week (Picture: PA)

They’re not the first partnership to have fallen under scrutiny this year, as AJ Pritchard and his celeb dancing buddy Saffron Barker have had to defend themselves over speculation.

After pictures emerged of them looking cosy together, the blogger’s reps told Metro.co.uk: ‘AJ and Saffron are great friends and have been training really hard for their performance on Saturday evening – this is clearly only what these pictures show.

‘They are loving the competition and cannot wait to perform their Cha-Cha to the Nation.’

AJ is, of course, dating dancer Abbie Quinnen, while Saffron is currently single.

Strictly Come Dancing continues Saturday at 6.40pm on BBC One.

Got a showbiz story? If you've got a story, video or pictures get in touch with the Metro.co.uk Entertainment team by emailing us celebtips@metro.co.uk, calling 020 3615 2145 or by visiting our Submit Stuff page - we'd love to hear from you.

MORE: The Circle welcomes new arrival Jan Jones as they reject Italian model who’s worked with Taylor Swift
description: David James furiously slams Strictly curse rumours with Nadiya Bychkova: 'I'm not on Love Island'.
